extendedInfo.description: Conflicts: Eastern Front is a huge turn based strategy game which takes place on the Russian Front in World War II.You are in command of the German WWII armed forces - generals, tanks, infantry and air force units - and the object of the game is to conquer the Soviet Union as quickly as possible.This is a huge game, and if you haven't played games fom the Conflict-series, you may want to start with Operation Barbarossa or D-Day before taking on the Eastern Front. If you want to test the game mechanics of Conflict-Series, a LITE version of Operation Barbarossa is available for free.What's different in Eastern Front compared to Operation Barbarossa:+ Scaled up: Larger map, more units, more panzers & Waffen SS, more cities... Now you can finally outmanoeuvre more than just couple of units to form Ã¼ber-encirclements.+ Tactical Areas/MPs: Some hexagons are connected together forming slowly evolving Tactical Areas, and you can move between such hexagons using Tactical MPs instead of regular MPs. This opens up a completely new tactical dimension.+ Economy & Production: You decide how to use the industrial resources that you capture: Build railway networks, produce Rail MPs, manufacture minefields, fuel, etc.+ Railway Network: To navigate the huge game area efficiently you need to plan where to build railway network.+ Generals: Generals support the closest units in battle at the cost of 1 MP, while the front line units located too far away from Generals might lose 1 MP.- Removed partizans, spies, full map, quotations and stats to reduce memory usage and to streamline the gameplay.FEATURES:+ Historical accuracy: Campaign mirrors the historical setup.+ Long-lasting: Thanks to in-built variation and the game's smart AI technology, each game provides a unique war gaming experience.+ Competitive: Measure your strategy game skills against others fighting for the Hall of Fame top spots.+ Experienced units learn new skills, like improved attack or defense performance, extra move points, damage resistance, ability to cross rivers without losing move points, etc.+ Settings: Various settings to alter the look of the gaming experience: different icon sets for units (real - NATO - web 2.0), custom font and map size, etc.+ Tablet friendly strategy game: Automatically scales the map for any physical screen size/resolution from small smartphones to HD tablets.+ Inexpensive: The entire WWII eastern front for the price of a coffee!In order to be a victorious general, you must learn to coordinate your attacks in two ways. First, as adjacent units give support to an attacking unit, keep your units in groups in order to gain local superiority. Secondly, it is rarely the best idea to use brute force when it is possible to encircle the enemy and cut off its supply lines instead.Answer the call of duty and join Conflict series on Facebook or Google Plus!+ http://on.fb.me/wsC2QV (FB)+ http://bit.ly/GHHGU1 (G+)Join your fellow strategy gamers in changing the course of the Second World War!The list below includes the permissions requested and the reasons for their use.+ Internet: To fetch Hall of Fame data from a server.+ Network State: To determine whether or not you are connected to the Internet so the game doesn't crash while trying to connect.+ Control Vibrator: To vibrate the phone during the battles.

reviews.title: I love this game
reviews.comment: Nice to see a good app with lots of support that does not try to hit you at for more money if you ever want to win.   Buy this game and let\'s keep this developer working!
reviews.author: marcelo schnettler

reviews.title: Addictive!
reviews.comment: Much like the Avalon Hill board games, love it! Wish I could play the soviet player tho. As for the undo feature- id bet Paulas and Vlassov wanted one too... How many Axis units bugged out at first sight of a tank or a division was pulled out if the front and sent nowhere by Hitler? Id like to see Europe 1780- 1815.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A Great game
reviews.comment: With the larger scale and production this a great expansion over Barbarossa.
reviews.author: Rex Lehmann

reviews.comment: Very good but if you\'re not careful, by turning your internet off whilst playing, then your data usage will be high.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Complex but beautiful
reviews.comment: Love the overall layout and UI of the game. Miss the spies of Op. Barbarossa
reviews.author: Devinder Singh

reviews.title: Some guidance for a 5 star
reviews.comment: I do think that this is a great game.  My problem is that the documentation is very sparse.  I\'ve learned more just from reading the reviews of the game than the game itself.  For a free game that would be okay, for a paid game I\'d really enjoy it more with some idea of how to use rail MP, tactical MP, why I should choose one production over another, etc.  Not saying its a bad game, I am enjoying playing it, and don\'t regret purchasing it.  I just wish there were a better way to learn how to play than trial and error.
reviews.author: Chris Weis

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.comment: Totally compulsive. I\'ve spent hours on it. Best war game on a tablet I\'ve come across.
reviews.author: Robert Cassells

reviews.title: Boring
reviews.comment: Beat it first go , railroad is to tedious , most challenging thing was trying to figure out how russia was getting 5-1 divisions when I was 200 miles east of moskow
reviews.author: kris smarkin

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Had problems earlier with resets but seems the updates fixed them. I\'ve been a big fan of this style of game for almost 30 years. Great job.
reviews.author: Peter Legg

reviews.title: Is this based on the Atari 800 Game.
reviews.comment: I remember a brilliant game written by a kid for the Atari 800 called Eastern front. It won the Annual APX or Atari Programme Exchange which was an original kinda Atari software kickstarter.
reviews.author: Robert Dudani

reviews.title: Wargamer\'s delight
reviews.comment: Perhaps the most ambitious game in the Conflicts series, this is easily the best and most complex wargame on Android right now. But this is not for beginners! Play some of the other games by Joni before committing to this juggernaut. While nowhere near the complexity of some PC wargames, the sheer scale here takes some work to master. You cannot win by force alone. On normal difficulty, it took me about a month of playing to win a 2-year campaign. The Soviet hordes will overwhelm you if you aren\'t careful!
reviews.author: George Ross

reviews.title: Best entry yet
reviews.comment: When I heard there was going to be another Eastern Front game in the series I was mildly disappointed-we have that. But this is fantastic. Each game just gets better. I love this!!!!! WE NEED NAVAL ACTION JONI!!! Really.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: One-more turn addiction
reviews.comment: Hard to put down. Updates keep coming. Joni takes pride in games and listens to feedback.
reviews.author: heinrich schwagel

reviews.title: Best yet
reviews.comment: The sense of scale is amazing and it also enables you to think not just in terms of individual units but also groups of units.
reviews.author: adrian li

reviews.title: Fun
reviews.comment: Good strategy game
reviews.author: Andrew Hernandez

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: Perfect
reviews.author: luis vasquez

reviews.title: Drang Nach Osten
reviews.comment: Excellent game with challenging AI. took a few attempts to find a winning strategy. Thoroughly recommended. A thought provoking game. Needs save feature for struggling players and scenario option eg Kursk 1943 for brevity.
reviews.author: Ray Wale

reviews.title: The best yet!
reviews.comment: I love these conflict series games and this one is the best most epic one yet, love it, how bout a defense of the fatherland 1945 campaign on the same scale as this game
reviews.author: Brian Finnegan

reviews.title: Engrossing war game
reviews.comment: Its an electronic board game that is vast in scope yet amazingly playable. A challenging AI keeps the game\'s outcome in doubt till the very final stages. Don\'t give up if you\'re near defeat: aggressive use of reinforcements can turn the Red Tide.
reviews.author: Barry Kelly

reviews.title: Wtf  guys
reviews.comment: I was right at Moscow,  about turn 40, load my game and there was a  compete  reset of territory, n  all  my units disappeared. I wanted to  masturbate with a cheese  grater.
reviews.author: Branden TheMan
